Method Detail

modify_class

public void modify_class()
                  throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Modify the class. First part is to implement modification depending on the interface (modification of callbacks) Second part handles internal modification of each method.

Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

signature

private java.lang.String signature(org.apache.bcel.classfile.Method m)
Gives back the signature of a method in Soot syntax.

Parameters:
m - the BCEL representation of the method
Returns:
a string following Soot conventions.

modify_method

private void modify_method(org.apache.bcel.classfile.Method m)
Modifies a method. We search for AspectJ method calls inserted after a new. We replace them with our own tag method that contains a position mark.

Parameters:
m -

modify_callback_method

private void modify_callback_method(CallbackDescription cd)
Takes a callback description that can be applied to the class and implements the modification which is a call inserted at the begining of the method. The signature of the method called is defined in the description but it is part of the controller class.

Parameters:
cd - the callback description (call to insert)

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
Program entry point. The only parameters are the name of the class to modify. The flag -d can be used to make the program more verbose.

Parameters:
argv - command line arguments.
